acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since the substance is a solid, it was classified into the "Not applicable" category.

aspiration_hazard.rationale:
No data available.
See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Salts of o-tolidine is rated as "Carc. Cat. 2" by the EU (2007). However, since details such as grounds for the rating are unclear, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale:
Regarding in vitro mutagenicity tests using 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine dihydrochloride (CAS: 612-82-8), a reverse mutation test using Salmonella typhimurium and a chromosomal aberration test using CHO cells both gave positive results (NTP DB, accessed in November 2007). However, since no appropriate in vivo test results are available, classification is not possible.
See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
In male rats given water containing 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine dihydrochloride (CAS: 612-82-8) an increased number of immature sperm was noted in the epididymis (Initial Environmental Risk Assessment of Chemicals (Ministry of the Environment), vol. 4, 2005). However, since we are unable to determine if administration in fact impairs fertility based on the report, classification is not possible.
See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No data available. See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (liver, kidney, lymph node, pancreas, thyroid, bone marrow)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, lymph node, pancreas, thyroid, bone marrow)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale:
In the experiment in which rats were administered with 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine dihydrochloride (CAS: 612-82-8) in drinking water for 13 weeks, the following effects were observed in treated rats: hepatocellular necrosis, accumulation of bile pigments, increased severity of nephtopathy, lymphocytic atrophy of the thymus, lymphocytic atrophy of the mandibular and mesenteric lymph nodes, focal acinar cell degeneration in the pancreas, decreases in serum triiodothyronine (T3) values, decreases in thyroxin (T4) concentrations, and atrophy of the bone marrow in high dose groups (NTP TR 390, 1991). Thus, we determined that the liver, kidney, lymph node, pancreas, thyroid gland, and bone marrow are target organs. All symptoms were seen at doses that fall under Category 1.
Therefore, 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine dihydrochloride was classified into Category 1 (liver, kidney, lymph node, pancreas, thyroid gland, and bone marrow)
See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
In humans, inhalation of small quantities of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine dihydrochloride (CAS: 612-82-8) induced sneezing followed by upper respiratory tract irritation (Initial Environmental Risk Assessment of Chemicals (Ministry of the Environment), vol. 4, 2005). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 3 for respiratory tract irritation.
See also the classification of 3,3'-dimethylbenzidine (CAS: 119-93-7) (NITE GHS classification ID 148).
